Exaggerate: The claim of "fake snow" in Texas is exaggerated as experts have debunked it.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a video showing a snowball blackening when heated, without considering the scientific explanation provided by experts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the blackening of the snowball is evidence of fake snow without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation provided by experts is that the blackening of the snowball is caused by incomplete combustion products and soot from the lighter, not fake snow.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the snowstorm in Texas in February 2021 was real and caused significant damage and disruption.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
